name: Sesame Shrimp and Snow Peas Stir-Fry
author: BacardiGirl
summary: This shrimp stir-fry is sooo tasty...quick to fix, too! You can also serve this over warmed rice noodles.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce, or more to taste
⅓ cup chopped red bell pepper
¼ cup thinly sliced green onions
1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 ½ cups cooked brown rice, warmed
directions: Combine chicken broth, soy sauce, sherry, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch in a bowl
Heat sesame oil in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat
Stir in bell pepper, onions, and garlic; fry until softened, 2 to 3 minutes
Add snow peas and cook, covered, until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes
Stir in shrimp and fry until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 2 to 3 minutes
Remove from heat and serve over cooked brown rice
